title: Musings on Identity
description:
What makes us who we are? Where we came from? where we live? What we believe? These are questions I have been pondering during these times

follow me on twitter @AndreaLynnLewis
email me at andreawiththebangs@gmail.com

transcript_parts.text: hello there friends Andrew with the
bangs here I'd like to talk today about
identity I've been thinking about
identity for the past few weeks really
the past few years but particularly in
the climate that we are currently
experiencing some say that identity is
very important the most important thing
particularly a certain aspect of
identity sexual identity racial identity
religious identity or class identity
these are things that some people really
zero in on and are very passionate about
being understood within the context of
that identity others say we are made up
of many identities and they all matter
but then they also sort of all don't
matter if they're all special than none
or special and we shouldn't be overly
concerned with one aspect the idea of
you know this sort of color blind like
oh we're all people it doesn't matter
these are the attitudes I have been
seeing you know from one side to the
other
with many different you know
perspectives in between but I've been
trying to understand why identity
matters you can take those ancestry calm
or 23andme tests you find out where are
you hail from now of course their
validity has been called into question
as to how accurate they are
but that's not what I'm talking about
right now why do people pay money to
find out where they come from what land
their people are descended from why does
this matter
if you found out that you had an
ancestor who was in the Holocaust
would that change how you see yourself
or if you had an ancestor who was a
slave
would that change how you see yourself
would that change how you saw others
nothing about you in this current
situation in your life has altered other
than that knowledge yet people want to
know people want to understand context
from which they huh and I don't have an
answer as to why although I do think it
is important I think you can zero in too
far on a particular aspect but I also
think it is unwise to dismiss identity
too easily
I've been thinking about my own identity
I don't have any parents I'm an orphan
since I was 24 years old my mother
passed away and my father passed away
when I was less than a year old my
grandmother passed away just a few
months ago but she was sort of the last
of the matriarch of the family and I
don't have that anymore that aspect of
my identity has been lost and now I feel
like I'm floating around untethered I've
lost my grounding I haven't changed my
daily life but in thinking about it it
something has changed though I am quite
interested in understanding what exactly
it is about identity that is so
important and why people yearn to
understand where they come from and who
they are as a result and I would love to
hear if any of you have any thoughts or
comments I don't have answers I just had
some musings that I wanted to get out
rather than going on Twitter and doing a
thread I thought it would be more free
to come and chat you in a video so thank
you for listening happy Canada today -
any Canadians out there why I'm wearing
the red and I hope you guys have a good
rest of your day
thanks for listening
